Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 09:49PM rjbaby69 wrote: Chulita - This board has been a God send for me.  I have learned so much.  I did get anti-anxiety meds and they have helped alot.  I am ready to get my surgery over with so that I can recover and move on to the next phase of my treatment.  It's been a rollercoaster ride in the beginning.  And I don't mind telling you that I am as scared as everyone else.  The women here are just absolutely wonderful and supportive.  Since I am single, I really can use some words of encouragement.  Thank you all so much.
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 10:05AM rjbaby69 wrote: Hi all.  I am scheduled for a lumpectomy with SNB on August 9.  Then I will go for scans.  Hoping and praying that everything turns out okay on the scans.  I will also have 6 weeks of radiation 5 times per week.  One day at a time!!
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2011 12:21AM rjbaby69 wrote: Vinade56:  Just counting the days until my surgery.  Sounds like you are doing very well.  My daughter bought me a new pillow for the ride home.  I thought that was sweet!  I hope I come through my surgery as well as you did.  I think I will try sleeping in my recliner too.  Sounds like that would be a better idea than trying to lay down in a bed. Sending warm wishes your way! Hugs!
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2011 06:57PM - edited Aug 9, 2011 06:58PM by rjbaby69 Hello Ladies!  Just wanted to give a little update.  Lumpectomy went really well today.  The doctor told my family that he didn't find any evidence of lymph node involvement, but he would know for sure tomorrow.  He also told me that he should have all the reports back by tomorrow and would be calling me as soon as he knew something.  I have a follow up appointment with him on August 16.  I was out of surgery and recovery about 9:00 a.m.  Went over to the hospital for scans.  Wasn't supposed to be there until 11:30, but they went ahead and fit me in.  How nice!!!  It really wasn't that bad.  It was an all day adventure.  I fell asleep while the bone scan was going on.  It was a nice 23 minute rest.  The CAT scan wasn't bad either.  The hardest part was trying to put my arm up out of the way.  Little painful.  Other than that, I'm fine. So far the pain isn't bad at all.  I have not had to take any of my pain meds.  I think I will take one tonight before bed so I can sleep. Want to wish all the ladies with upcoming surgery lots of luck and little pain.  All the ladies that have already been through surgery, I hope you are all doing well too. Talk to you soon. HUGS!!  And big ones at that!!
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2011 07:11PM rjbaby69 wrote: Posy1:  I was diagnosed in July by vacuum assisted core needle biopsy.  I knew that I had IDC but did not find out my stage or grade until after I got copies of my biopsy results.  I knew from that they had graded me a 1.  Still didn't know the stage until after the final path report after my lumpectomy (which also included a SNB) in August.  Dr. didn't think I had node involvement, but surprise, surprise, 2 of 4 nodes positive with cancer.  Thus, with node involvement and size of tumor (bigger than originally thought) I was staged a IIb.  I did not start chemo until after my surgery.  Had surgery August 9, port placed on August 31 and first chemo on September 8.  I have to do 6 TC.  I have done 3 and have 3 more to go.  Halfway home!  After that I will have 6 weeks of radiation 5 days per week.  Then on to tamoxifen since I am ER/PR +. Hope this helps. Sending  you great big cyber hugs!
Posts.Title: Coping with the wait for the Stage TectonicShift Beeb75

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2011 05:41PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hang in there Posy1.  I always (and everyone of us does) hate the waiting.  I knew my grade and ER/PR HER status from the biopsy but I did not find out my stage until after surgery.  I also had the lumpectomy and SNB.  As far as the surgery goes, I hope you are doing well.  I hated the drain!  I had to leave mine in 2 weeks and I thought I would never get that darn thing out!  What a relief when I did. I am taking chemo right now.  I have TC x 6 and I have just finished tx #4 today.  So I have 2 more to go.  Not a walk in the park, but like so many others have said, it is doable.  I will also have radiation for 5 days per week for 6 weeks.  I am so not looking forward to that.  It's really not the radiation that bothers me, but I have to drive at least 45 minutes one way to get to the facility for 5 minutes of radiation!  Really messes up my work day.  Somehow or another I will get through that too. Thinking of you and wishing you well! HUGS!
Posts.Title: Coping with the wait for the Stage TectonicShift Beeb75

Posts.Content: rjbaby69 wrote: First, I'd like to say hello to all you wonderful people.  I have been lurking around here for a few days.  Now it's time for me to join.  Little history.  I am 50 years old, have 2 wonderful grown daughters, and 2 beautiful grandkids.  I am single and have been divorced from my youngest's father since 1994.  Life has been very good up until now.  Now I begin the rollercoaster ride that all of you talk about.  I found the lump sometime in late May or early June.  Messed around for about a month thinking it was nothing and would go away.  Wrong!  Went to OB/GYN on July 13.  She recommended a mamo and US which was done on July 15.  I had had my regular yearly mammo in January and got a clean bill of health.  I don't know what the mammo showed but the US showed a mass that was not fluid filled.  Okay, I'm thinking just some kind of tumor, probably not cancer, even though I knew in my gut when she told me that, that I had cancer.  Dr. told me I needed to do a US core biopsy.  I scheduled the appointment for this last Tuesday.  Today, the Dr. called and told me that the news was not what we wanted.  I did indeed have cancer.  I, at least remembered to ask what kind it was.  It is Invasive Ductal Carcinoma.  My OB/GYN said it felt to be about 2 cm.  I really don't have any other details.  I am scheduled to see a onc on Monday at 4:00.  I suspect there will be lots more tests and things after he reviews the reports.  I, of course, will ask for copies. I am adopted and that makes any kind of medical history even harder....I don't know mine.  Right now I'm just trying to take it one day at a time and enjoy my kids and grandkids.  I know BC is not an automatic death sentence anymore, but it is scarey.  I am a strong woman with a good support group.  I have had several employees get BC and they are still alive today.  So I know it can be treated successfully. I will post more information after I talk with my onc dr. on Monday.  Thanks for letting me join the club that no one wants to join.  I look forward to learning lots of things about bc.  My biggest concern right now is that the cancer has spread to my lungs.  Unfortunately, I do smoke and have for at least 34 years.  Not good, I know.  I am going to try to smoke my e-cig more and hopefully I will be able to quit regular cigs. Thanks. Dx 7/20/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 1, 2/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 07:34PM rjbaby69 wrote: Bedo if I can ask, what made you choose lumpectomy or did you have a choice?  I was presented with two choices today and I need to let them know as soon as possible.  I want to sleep on it and hear from some of you ladies that had a lumpectomy/rads.  Thanks for your support. I know what you mean about those clerks.  I had the same feeling, "who me have a nice day?  Are you kidding?  I have breast cancer!" is what I wanted to shout.  I, on the other hand, cope better by talking through it with my friends and family.  I live in a small community and when "the news broke" it was like a chain reaction.  So many people calling and asking how I was, many people called to ask me if they could put me on the prayer lists at church, so many offers for help.  I have so many offers for help that I started assigning chores, i.e., future son-in-law...mow the yard, co-workers at part-time job.....bring ice cream, ex-mother-in-law.....cook for me please!, coaches at school....send chocolate!  Well, heck, might as well accept the help they are offering!  LOL!  People here have been good to me and I am so blessed. Talk to you soon.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 03:54PM rjbaby69 wrote: Okay ladies, after sleeping on all the information here and from my doctor, my decision is a lympectomy.  I feel very confident in that decision.  After talking with some of you here, I feel like that is my best option at this time.  I don't want to be away from work very long and I do have a fear of infection and such.  And I can't get the dr.s words out of my head, "you are a perfect candidate for lumpectomy".  After sleeping on it, this feels like the right thing for me.  I thank you all for your comments and your stories.  They really and truly help.  I will keep you posted.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 07:20PM rjbaby69 wrote: Wasn't as bad as I thought Apple.  Now the decision making comes into play.  Grade 1  woopeee!  I am so thankful.  Thanks for your support!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2011 08:45PM rjbaby69 wrote: Welcome Jaykayjo.  So sorry you are here but you will find lots of great ladies and lots of much needed support. Your report sounds extremely encouraging.  I am hoping I get as good a report. How was your lumpectomy?  Any problems?  How should I prepare? Hugs.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 08:06AM rjbaby69 wrote: I am pretty sure they are doing these scans and stuff because when we were talking to the BS my girls told him about my shoulder and hip hurting pretty bad.  And I did tell him that I was very afraid about my lungs.  So he told me then we would do scans just to make sure.  Funny thing about the hip and shoulder pain, it disappears if I take ibuprophen or Aleve.  I know that is a good sign but I'm still worried.  And I would like to have them done just to know for sure and ease my mind.  I played softball for many, many years and I was the pitcher.  So I really feel like my shoulder pain could be arthritis from all those years of pitching.  But I'm not sure.  It is my right shoulder and hip, same side as my breast cancer. Hugs!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2011 08:55PM rjbaby69 wrote: Holly and Rain:  Yes I thougth that was a little odd too, but in a way I would like to go ahead and get them over with.  Then I will be through and can go home and crash.  Doing this will save me another 45 minute drive back to the Center.  I will definitely let you know what happens.  Little scared about what these tests are going to show but I'm trying really hard not to go there.  I have an appointment with my PCP tomorrow to discuss anti-anxiety meds.    My bs approved but did not want me to be "out of it" because I may have more decisions to make.  I was diagnosed with panic disorder in 1993 and have been on these kinds of meds before so I do know it will help.  I have been off them for many years now but I know the signs and it's time.  Thought I might make it through it without them, uh....no. Hugs!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 10:46AM - edited Jul 28, 2011 10:47AM by rjbaby69 Thanks Hanta!  I appreciate all the information! Hugs.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2011 10:25AM rjbaby69 wrote: Thank you to all of you for the support.  I am sure I will find out lots more information when I see the dr on Monday.  My OB/GYN called today to check on me and answer any questions that I might have.  I thought that was really sweet.  She was making sure that I had made an appointment with a dr to begin my treatment.  In many ways, I feel very lucky.  The timing is horrible, but I know I will be okay.  I am so inspired by the many stories of the women here who have been through treatment and are now cancer free.  Once again, thanks for the support.  It means alot to me.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2011 02:37PM rjbaby69 wrote: Now that I know, the hardest part is not knowing if it has spread into my nodes or not.  But yes, once I get some answers Monday and get a plan of action, I know I will feel tons better. Thanks so much for the support!  I really need that right now.  I'm trying so hard to be the strong woman everyone thinks I am, but I still have my moments. Thanks again for your support.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2011 03:16PM rjbaby69 wrote: Thanks Deb and Suzanne.  Today the tears came!  Out in my pool by myself and I just lost.  My pet peeve of the day:  How are YOU today?  How the hell do you think I am?  I have cancer for God's sake!  I scared out of my wits!  When I beat this thing I'm going to be broke and I hope like hell I will be able to keep my house and everything else I've worked so hard for!  My heart breaks for my kids and my grandkids cause they don't know if Mom is going to be here tomorrow.  And how should I feel?  I feel the same way today that I did yesterday, and the day before and last month and last year!  Geez!  Are you asking me if I feel like I have cancer.....then NO! Okay enough of that for today.  On a positive note, the breast center that I go to (I'm in Arkansas) has what they call a cancer coach.  How cool!  The lady called me today and told me who she was and that her role at the hospital was to follow me from diagnosis to the end of treatment.  She would be there to explain to me every step of the way what was happening, what I could expect at the appoints, etc.  All I could think of was MORE SUPPORT!  Hell yes!  I am so excited about that.  She is someone that I can call and talk to anytime.  That feels so good!  I am just wondering if any of you have this? Well time for me to read and then go to some laundry.  Have some friends coming over tonight.  I'm ready to just have a good time!  Have a good weekend ladies.  I will talk to you soon!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 04:46AM - edited Jul 25, 2011 04:47AM by rjbaby69 Today is the day.  I go see the surgeon today and get all of my results and see what other tests he will order.  I'm very nervous and I'm afraid of what he is going to say.   Every little creak and pain has me believing that I already have mets.  Please just let it be in my breast!!  Wish me luck.  Will let everyone know soon.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 04:58PM rjbaby69 wrote: Now I have decisions to make!  First, let me back up.  He said that I do have IDC and it is a grade 1.  He estimates that it is about 1 - 1.5 cm.  We discussed masectomy and lumpectomy in detail.  I know I have said that I was looking at a double masectomy with reconstruction but now I'm not so sure.  He said that I was a perfect candidate for lumpectomy.  The only downfall I have is I will have to do 6 weeks of radiation at 5 x per week.  That means I will have to travel to the center which is 45 minutes away 5 days a week.  One daughter says masectomy and the other says lumpectomy.  Both of them went with me and had a list of questions which he answered completely.  I really like this surgeon.  He was in no hurry and took all the time we needed and never made us feel rushed.  I liked that.  He told me that if I choose lumpectomy that he would watch me very closely for a long time to make sure everything went according to plan.  I will be having all the scans and stuff in the next week or so.  He told me that if I haven't called him in a week he would call me.  He told us that once I made a decision he would start assembling the team and we would get started. So, now what?  I'm as confused as ever.  By the way, they will be mailing all my stuff that I asked for.  I really liked this office and the atmosphere.  That helps a bunch, huh? Ladies what did you choose and why?
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 07:25PM rjbaby69 wrote: Thank you Maria.  You are so kind and I appreciate your support.  As you know, I need some kind words and some support.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 05:54PM rjbaby69 wrote: Knic you are so right!  I am so thankful for each and every day that I am given now.  I believe for the first time I am living in the present and living each day to the fullest.  It has given me a new meaning of life.  Hard lesson but a lesson that I am learning for me.  I am hoping that my nodes are neg too.  Dr. doesn't feel any thing inflamed and that's good but won't know for sure until after the surgery.  Worried about getting to my rads too because I live about 45 mintues away, but somehow, I know I will get there.  Have lots of support here and I intend to call on them when needed.  You are right.  Nothing has been on my mind since I first found the lump but this.  Last night I got a really good nights sleep.  I think it was because I knew I was making the right decision for me.  That's a good feeling.  And with that comes the knowledge that if I do have to deal with this again, I will be able to do it. Thanks for your support.  I truly appreciate each and everyone on this board.  It has really helped me and I am gratefull.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2011 03:19PM rjbaby69 wrote: I have been deeply touched today by a breast cancer survivor and co-worker.  Today she dropped by the office to turn in some paperwork and had brought me a pink bracelet with the words, "I am a survivor" on it.  I am so touched!  I have found the prayers, well-wishes and such from everyone to be a wonderful mood lifter when I'm still shaking in my boots! So, my lumpectomy is scheduled for August 9 at 6:00 a.m.  I think I'm the first one that day!  Yeah!  I'm ready to get on with my treatment.  Then I will find out so much more.  The nurse said that after my surgery (outpatient) I will have to go to the main hospital to admissions and be admitted for my bone scans, MRI and any other tests that my doctor has ordered.  Seemed a little odd to me that they would do this after surgery, but okay.  They're in charge.  I'm hoping they will put me in a room and come get me for every test.  I plan on sleeping in between if they do. Is there anything I need to plan for that day?  I am planning on leaving my dentures at home.  I have an upper set and I don't have to have them and I don't want to have to keep up with them all day.  I am also planning on leaving my jewerly (earrings, watch) at home so I don't have that hastle either.  I plan to wear a pair of comfortable shorts, big shirt and sports bra.  If you can think of any thing that was helpful for you, please let me know. Thanks!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 08:14AM rjbaby69 wrote: Nanorama:  Thankfully I do have insurance.  But I've found it's not near enough!  LOL!  Bless my girls' hearts, they are determined that we will not loose the house.  Both have said they would be willing to help me pay my bills, especially my house payment until this is over!  The youngest, she's 20, will be starting school this fall for radiology.  Go figure.  She told me the other day that if she had already been through school, she may have been my radiologist!  LOL!  The oldest, she's 32 with my 2 grandbabies, has a minimum wage job but she is willing to do what it takes to help.  Bless their hearts! And my nurse navigator sent me a lot of information about organizations that can help with co-pays and prescriptions, etc.  Very encouraging.  I do have disability insurance through my employment which will also help.  So maybe, just maybe I will be okay.  I am a single, independent woman.  Both my parents have passed away.  I have 2 older step-brothers and an older step-sister.  I did see my PCP today and will be taking a low dose of xanax and immipramine.  So I am feeling better or at least I will be soon.  LOL! Now I am concentrating on getting my job in order.  So much to do!  Thanks for your support.  Hugs!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 02:33AM rjbaby69 wrote: The youngest daughter and I plan on going shopping right before my surgery.  I think I need to invest in a bra that opens in the front.  My be a whole lot easier for me to deal with right now.  Claire you are so right.  I'm hoping that this is an "oh sh*t" for me too.  I'm feeling very confident in the diagnosis but very apprehensive about the other tests.  I am just hoping and praying that nothing is no where else in my squatty little body.  You know?  Very scarey. Hugs.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 07:18PM - edited Jul 25, 2011 07:19PM by rjbaby69 Thanks Beacon.  Mine is on the right side which is good.  I have no history of heart trouble but I am adopted so I really don't know much.  I'm not as young as I used to be!  LOL!  But I don't feel old at 50 either and I'd like to stay around a while and watch my grandbabies grow up.  I was so nervous before I got into see the doctor!  I thought I was gonna throw up.  Nerves are funny things aren't they?  Yes I'm thankful that my breast surgeon and I "hit it off" cause he did tell me that after the surgery he would be watching me very closely for a while!  Made me feel good. Thanks again for your suport Beacon.  It is important to me as I walk this road.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 05:42PM rjbaby69 wrote: You are so right Ellen.  This board has been such an inspiration to me.  I have learned so much and my heart goes out to each and every one here.  Don't really want to be here, but here I am.  Hopefully things will be okay for me.  I am feeling so much better that a decision is made and I can move forward.  Now, I am awaiting the date of surgery from the doctor.  Bad timing, but is there really any good time to deal with this?  I have a strong support system and for that I am thankful.  I thank you for your suport!  Hugs!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 05:48PM rjbaby69 wrote: Beacon I think that is exactly what happened to me.  When I first started getting mammos when I was 42, I had to go back every 6 months for 2 years.  They told me then that I had dense breasts.  I think that's one reason nothing ever showed up.  But the Dr. did say that he saw nothing on my mammo from January 11.  Little scarey isn't it?  And I feel the same way about more surgery.  If they get in there and find problems, well I have the option of mx then.  I'm not scared of more surgery, I just want to get this cancer under control.  I also know that if it comes back, it can come back anywhere.  Scarey but true.  At least I am at peace with my decision and I'm ready to move forward.  I truly thank you all for your support.  It is invaluable to me.  Hugs.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2011 03:12PM rjbaby69 wrote: Thanks raincitygirl.  I did take a look around that website and it is very interesting!  I will have to visit again when I have more time!  Thanks for your support.

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 07:57AM rjbaby69 wrote: Received the path report today.  It says: Invasive ductal carcinoma, concordant. ER+ 95%, HR+ 97%, HER-2/NEU Negative Grade I One of the pages says: Final Diagnosis Breast, right 9 o'clock, needle core biopsy:  Estensively involved by invasive ductal carcinoma, Nottingham Grade I, 1.7 cm in greatest contiguous dimension.

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 12:15PM rjbaby69 wrote: No Mommarch.  He hasn't said anything about that.  The only thing he has mentioned is that if I needed chemo that I might be able to take that in pill form.  Yippee!  Never thought about a gas card!  That would be nice.  I see I have some more investigation to do.  Thanks for all your suggestions! Hugs.
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 12:22PM rjbaby69 wrote: Nan my girls made me feel so good!  I have always been the take charge, get er done, type person and I know it's hard on them to think that "MOM" is down.  But I also think they feel good knowing that I am leaning on them for help and support.  Usually it's the other way around.  LOL!   Lots of good suggestions and stuff here on the board that I am going to have to investigate.  I'm feeling better today than in a while. Did see my PCP today for meds and I also got the dreaded blood pressure med.  He had been threatening for about a year if it didn't come down....well, today was the day.  My blood pressure was 160/102.  Not good!  So he said I had to get control of that blood pressure before surgery and I now have another pill to take in addition to my imipramine and xanax.  Oh, well.  As long as it helps.  In case you're wondering, the imipramine is for panic attacks.  In 1993 I think it was I was diagnosed with panic disorder and was put on xanax and imipramine.  Worked wonders!  Back on the meds now after having been off them for more than 10 years. Hugs!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2011 05:07AM rjbaby69 wrote: Just wanted to give everyone an update. Had my lumpectomy yesterday (Aug. 9) and everything went very well.  I did invest in a couple pair of PJ's and a sports bra that zips up the front.  Very good idea! My doctor called today to give me the results of my scans.  Bone scan, ct scan and blood work came back clear!  Yeah!  But....he removed 4 nodes and 2 had cancer.  Bummer.  I guess I will be doing chemo as well as radiation.  I think he was surprised about the lymph nodes.  He had told my family that he didn't think they had cancer but he wouldn't know for sure until the path report came back.  What does this mean now?  Do I have a bigger chance of getting cancer again since it was in my nodes?  I am still feeling very positive about the scans but apprehensive about the nodes. I have a follow-up appointment with my doctor on Tuesday and I'm sure we will discuss my treatment plan and where I go from here.  And I hope he takes this damned drain tube out!  Ugh!  That's been the worst part of this whole ordeal!!! My girls have been great!  The oldest one came over today to help me shower.  Both have taken turns emptying the drain bulb and I don't have to lift a finger to do nothing I don't want to do!  Ahhhh!  Yes, absolutely I am taking advantage of all the attention!  My friends and family have been over today and everyone has brought food so we won't have to cook until this weekend.  The staff at the surgery center was wonderful!  I had mentioned that when I got home, the first thing I was gonna get was a Dr. Pepper!  One of the nurses went and got me a Dr. Pepper and told me I wouldn't have to wait, I could have one now!  That was so kind! Thank you for your support.  It means the world to me.  I have pretty much moved over to the IDC thread now.  And I will probably join the others (chemo, radiation, etc.) as I go through this process. Thanks so much for caring about me.  I appreciate each and everyone of you and the battle we are all going through! HUGS!
Posts.Title: Need to Join - Got My Results rjbaby69 rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 07:13PM rjbaby69 wrote: Thanks Holly!  My surgeon urged me to not make any decisions right now, but to sleep on it a night or two but he said that if I hadn't called him in a week, he would be calling me.  LOL!  He won't have to wait that long, but I did want to talk to my step-sister and my step-sister-in-law.  I'm fairly close to both of them and I wanted their opinion.  There are a couple of ladies here in town that have had lumpectomies that I know pretty well and I'd like to talk to them too tomorrow.  So for now, just doing a bit of research and trying to decide which way to go.  Whew!  Choices, choices choices.  At least I have some and for that I'm thankful!  Talk to you soon!

Hugs!
Posts.Title: Stranding? CarsonAriesGrl rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2011 08:48AM rjbaby69 wrote: I had two node positive, so I definitely am having chemo.  Also, the size of my tumor was 2.9 cm which is really bigger that what the mammo or US showed.  Lympnode involvement surprised me and my surgeon.  Soon as he told me I had 2 of 4 lympnodes positive, I knew I was getting chemo.  I was sure hoping it wasn't so.  I think it depends. Hugs.

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2011 09:07AM rjbaby69 wrote: Becky:  Wonderful advice!  Since my incision is on the side of my breast, I had no idea they made those types of bras.  That is so good to know! HUGS!

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2011 08:54AM rjbaby69 wrote: MrsM:  I used neosporin with pain relief at first.  Then after my incision healed a bit, I used vitamin E oil.  Not sure this will help, but it's worth a shot.  My incision is at the 9 o'clock and on the outside of my breast.  I had my lumpectomy in August.  Even now, sometimes my bra rubs the incision a little.  I feel like my breast is still swollen some on that side.  But all in all, it doesn't really bother me. Hugs!

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2011 07:05PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hey Pil and Kmg.  I also live in Arkansas and all my doctors are in Little Rock.  Dr. Hagans is my breast surgeon and Dr. Baltz is my oncologist.  All my stuff has been through the Baptist Breast Center.  Where are ya'll going, if I may ask.  We may run into each other!  Hugs.
Posts.Title: Rare 1% to 2% of women pil rjbaby69

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 11:36AM rjbaby69 wrote: I am so sorry for all the waiting and the stress.  You have gotten some good advice from the other ladies.  When I got my diagnosis, which was less than a week after mammo, US, and biopsy, I immediately went to my primary care doctor for Xanax and Immipramine.  I suffer from panic attacks and the diagnosis sent me in a tailspin.  These drugs have calmed my attacks and I am functioning much better. My biopsy was an US guided biopsy and I felt nothing but was awake and talking to the nurses and doctor.  It was a fairly quick procedure.  Two days later the doctor called with the results.  Since July 19, I have had a lumpectomy with SNs taken out.  You can see in my signature line my diagnosis.  I have now had my second chemo treatment and I am doing farily well. Take care of yourself first and foremost.  Like VSM said, take care of the pneumonia first.  Then you can put one foot in front of the other.  We are all here for you and are hoping for B9 results.  You can PM me anytime if you'd like. HUGS!
Posts.Title: Feeling Lost and disconnected dragonfly55 dragonfly55

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2011 07:17PM rjbaby69 wrote: Linda, I don't have an answer for you on that one.  But I, too, and having some pain and soreness but it is the arm on the side that I had a lumpectomy.  It is the underside of my right arm.  There was no cutting or anything like that, so I don't know why it's so sore.  It seems to be getting better so that's a good thing. That is very strange for it to be hurting in the opposite arm.  My opposite arm feels great!  Sorry I can't help but I did find your post interesting. Hugs.

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 10:58AM rjbaby69 wrote: I am also diagnosed as stage IIb and I hope to be where you are in 7 years.  Still here and enjoying my life and my kids and grandkids.  Thanks so much for the uplifting post! HUGS!

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2012 10:21PM rjbaby69 wrote: Msphil:  Always love it when you get to tell someone you are an 18 year survivor!  I want to be like you, my friend.  Warm hugs sent your way. Harley63:  So glad when I hear from ladies who have survived for a number of years.  I so want to be like you all. HUGS!
Posts.Title: Scared and feeling unlucky chrissera marjie

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2011 03:20AM rjbaby69 wrote: DeborahK, it's really all doable.  I'm glad you have a port.  I have one too and it's been a lifesaver for me.  I am currently through with TX #4 of TC (Taxotere and Cytoxin).  I have 2 more to go and am feeling really good about my prognosis. I wouldn't say I freaked out, I was just worried about the side effects the first couple of treatments. Once I experienced those, I was better able to prepare myself for the next round.  I think you will find that chemo is not as bad as you think it is.  I hope you can go through this as well as I have.  There are lots of wonderful ladies on this board that will be there to help you along, including me.  We got this!  I would try to find some info about Adriamycin because I didn't have that so I'm really not knowledgeable.  I understand from reading on the board that the Taxol was much easier for most to tolerate. I wish you the best! HUGS!
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last month and anxious about chemo starting DeborahK seacretgardn

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2012 10:19PM rjbaby69 wrote: Just stopping by to let you know that you are in my thoughts.  I began my journey last July.  I refused to let the cancer diagnosis get me.  I was scared, didn't know what to expect, but bound and determined to do everything in my power to conquer the beast!  I can't believe it has almost been a year since I found my lump but it has.  This site and the ladies (and gentlemen) here are absolutely the best.  I got more helpful information off these boards than I ever could have gotten anywhere else. Just remember you are not alone.  We are all here to help you and support you. HUGS!
Posts.Title: Scared and feeling unlucky chrissera marjie

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2012 08:28AM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  Hope you are all doing well. I had a lumpectomy in August followed by chemo (TC x 6) September through December and will be starting radiation on January 9th.  I had my consultation meeting on December 29.  I am so ready to get this over with.  I will have to drive to the "big" city for treatment which means time away from work.  At any rate, I am almost through with this part of my treatment and I am truly thankful for that.  After radiation, plans are to go on Tamoxifen for 5 years (if I can stand it). I look forward to being here with you and sharing our experiences.  If I hadn't discovered forum, I don't know what I would have done.  This forum has been a life-saver for me and I appreciate each and everyone for all that they do to make it better for the rest of us. Hope you all have a wonderful day and I will check back soon. HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2012 10:14PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  Had my 5th of 30 treatments today.  So far, everything has been uneventful.  It takes me longer to drive there (45 minutes) than it does to get the radiation (10 minutes).  LOL!  I did visit with my nurse yesterday about skin care and she told me that they prefer that I do not use anything on my breasts and that if I needed something, they would give me some special cream. So far, radiation is turning out to be a walk in the park compared to the chemo.  I just try to remember there is an end in sight.  My last treatment should be February 22.  Yippee! Hope you all do well with your radiation treatments.  I will check in soon. HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2012 09:57PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  All is going well so far with me and my radiation.  Skin is holding up nicely....no peeling, burns or anything else.  I do have a little soreness and a full feeling but my RO and nurse tell me this is all normal.  Not using any creams or anything else.  Don't really have a need right now.  My breast is a little red but that is all. Findingsolace:  My nails are not black but you can definitely tell that I've had some sort of medical problem.  They are more of a tan/yellowish looking where they have pulled away from the beds.  I can't tell yet if I will loose any or not.  I'll just have to wait and see.  There are a couple of them that I'm worried about because the discoloration seems to be over more than half the nail.  Just don't know right now.  I'll keep you posted.  I hate the swelling for you.  It's pretty aggravating to me.  And I am a month from chemo and still have some swelling issues.  Hopefully they will resolve themselves soon. amfo99:  I, too, believe it's a personal choice.  But my choice was to do anything and everything I can to make sure I don't have to go through this again. So I agree with Ossa. I intend to do everything in my power to keep myself healthy. I feel that the effects of radiation are a small price to pay if it will zap whatever microscopic cells that may be left in my body. I do NOT want to do this again. But in the end, it is your decision and a very personal one.  We all want you to do what's best for you. HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2012 10:02PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  I see we are all doing as well as can be expected.  I have 2 whole breast rads to go and 5 boosts.  They measured me for boosts today and also the RO prescribed sulfadene (sp?) for the area underneath my breast.  It is so so, red, and the skin is peelling really bad.  So I use Aquafor for most of my boob except the underneath part.  I will be so glad when this is OVER!    If all goes well, I will have my last treatment a week from Thursday!  Yeah! Here's wishing each and every one of you well and I hope you sail through your treatments with ease! Love and HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Feb 29, 2012 09:24PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  Enjoyed reading your posts tonight.  I am so sorry for those of you that are having some problems.  I am so happy to welcome more to the "Finished" club.  I am so glad this part is over. Maggie:  "Slathering"!  I love it!  I used that word the other day at the office and my boss told me he had never heard that word before.  I told him he couldn't be from the south then!  LOL!  I loved seeing you use it too.  At least I know I'm not the only one that knows what it means!   Hang it there! Surprisingly, my skin is healing very quickly and I really am feeling good.  The area under my arm and around the nipple is peeling pretty badly but still seems to be healing.  My breast is no longer that deep, dark reddish purple, but looks more like a tan now.  The RO told me in about 10 days I should be in really good shape.  I finished last Thursday so it's been almost 7 days for me and so far, he seems to be correct. Starting to feel a little funny because I'm not constantly running somewhere to a doctor.  Feels a little weird.  I guess I am just trying to find my new normal.  Little scarey too.  I mean, you know, what's keeping the cancer at bay now?  Well, I am supposed to start tamoxifen on March 5.  I really hope I don't have any bad SE's from that. Here's wishing everyone well and quick healing.  Hang in there.  There is a light at the end of this tunnel.  You are all in my thoughts! HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2012 07:52PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  Hope you are all doing well this evening. Momine, Anafoefana, Ossa:  Yes I had the terrible Taxotere.  My nails have pulled away from their beds and look horrible but appear to maybe be getting better.  Hands peeled like a snake skin and hurt really bad but they have healed up nicely and now my skin is just dry, but not peeling anymore.  So I hope this swelling goes away soon.  I sleep with my feet on a pillow at night and that helps alot. Other than that, I am bracing for SE's to set in this week.  My Rad Onc told me that they normally start seeing SE's around the 3rd week and I am beginning my 3rd week tomorrow.  But CARTI, which is where I go, is really good about taking care of their patients.  I see a nurse once a week and the Dr. on Mondays.  Both check for any unusual appearance or swelling of my breast or arm.  They did tell me that they have creams for me to use if I need them.  So far, I have not used anything.  But I am prepared to ask in case I do. Hope you all have a wonderful evening.  We have had tornadoes all around us tonight but things seem to be quieting down now.  I am glad!  I hate to have severe weather at night.  Can't see nothing! HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2011 07:54PM rjbaby69 wrote: Welcome Sheri to the club that no one wants to join.  Did  you have a biopsy to confirm?  It says that you have mets.  Can I ask where? Hugs.

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2012 05:59PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  Hope everyone is doing well. I have finished my 2nd week and have 4 more to go.  If everything goes smoothly, I should be through with rads on February 22.  At least I am seeing an end in sight and that certainly looks good to me! Still under the care of my BS and my Onc.  Had my port removed last Friday because it got infected over the Christmas holidays.  I have a little fluid build up where the port was and I am so afraid he is going to drain it on the 24th when I go back for post-op visit.  I am so tired of everyone coming at me with needles!  Yikes!  Can I just be done already? Hope you all have a wonderful weekend. HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 07:12PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  Glad to see everyone is moving right along. I finished treatment #16 today.  So far just a lot of redness and soreness.  My boob is also swollen.  My RO said all this was normal.  So far, I've only used Aloe Vera gel once.  Ossa, I might try your recommendation for the redness.  I'm still wearing my regular bras but I think I may need to move to my sport bras soon.  The regular bras are starting to get uncomfortable. Hope everyone has a wonderful day tomorrow.  Talk to ya soon! HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2012 10:45AM rjbaby69 wrote: Morning ladies. I can so relate to everything you all have said.  I am so sick and tired of being sick and tired.  I am tired of feeling like crap most days.  I'm tired of swelling.  I'm tired of driving back and forth to the big city every day.  I just want my life back.  I want to be okay and well and living wild and free like I was.  I am so tired of "being the one with cancer."  This all just sucks and I will be so glad when the day comes that active treatment is done.  Maybe then my dr appointments will slow down and I can get on with living again without being reminded every day of what I have been through. Take care ladies and thanks for letting me vent!  Felt so good! HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2012 05:29PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hi ladies!  Hope you are all doing well. I am so excited cause I only have 10 more to go!  Yeah!  I am so ready to get this over with.  I am now using the cream my RO gave me.  I have peeling skin under the fold of my breast and I noticed today that my nipple area was trying to peel too!  Ugh!  Went to wearing my sports bras cause they are lots more comfortable.  I usually go braless around the house.  Can't seem to find the time to lay down and put a fan on my boob.  The RO told me this would help dry out the area underneath my breast.  That may be true, but right now, I just can't find the time!!! Hope you all have a good day and treatment (if you are still having them) tomorrow! HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2012 04:18PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hi ladies.  I see all of us are tolerating this stuff pretty well.  I do my last boost tomorrow!  Yeah!  I will be done.  I will be thinking about all of you and checking back in.  Have lots going on in my life right now so don't know how often I'll get to "talk" to you.  But everyone please hang in there!  It will get better.  My skin is burnt and underneath the breast the skin is peeling away.  After the last boost tomorrow I will be able to slather the silverdene and all my other lotions all over my breast without worrying about all the markings!  I am so ready! Hope you all have a great day tomorrow! HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2012 08:31PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies!  I am officially done!  Yippee!  Now it's back to work without having to drive back and forth to the big city.  So looking forward to it!  Skin is really red and peeling but now I can put all my lotions and stuff all over my breast without worrying about where I'm putting it!  Don't have to worry about the markings anymore.  Yeah!  Today when I came out of the radiation room, they sounded a bell and presented me with a diploma that stated that I had finished the prescribed treatment.  Had my name on it and the date and everything.  I wasn't expecting that but really but a nice touch on everything! Hope you all do well. Hugs!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2012 05:48PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  Had my first treatment today and it wasn't as bad as I thought it was going to be.  I had to do a simulation first which took about an hour and then on to the real thing.  That took about 20 minutes.  My radiologists and the other staff are so nice and helpful and they make me feel so good about doing this.  My radiologist told me today that the treatments from now on will actually be about 5 minutes long total.  That means it will take me longer to get there (45 minutes) than the treatment itself will be.  They did some more mapping today and I feel like I am a road map!  LOL!  I didn't or don't have any tattoos.  All of my stuff is drawn with marker on me.  She said that they would touch up the markings as needed since they will see me everyday.  If everything goes as planned, I should be through February 22.  At last, an ending to treatments in sight!  Yeah! Hope everyone is doing well. HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2012 02:57PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  See everyone is continuing on their pace.  Sorry for those of you that the machine broke down.  That's a bummer.  I sure hope they call me welllll in advance since I have to leave almost an hour before my appointment if that ever happens to me. I have managed to get 2 weeks (10 treatments) under my belt and now my breast is sore and I feel achy all over.  Really get stiff if I sit a long time and kinda hard to get going again.  I'm going to blame it on the rads.  LOL!  I don't know what else it could be.  I do feel much better as far as SE's go.  Taste buds are returning and I find myself eating a lot right now.  Guess I'll be gaining back that 12 pounds I lost.  Oh, well!  Still have some swelling in my feet and legs.  I wonder when that will go away.  Maybe never huh? Hope everyone has a wonderful weekend. HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2012 03:45PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  So glad everyone is progressing right along. I finished 3 weeks of 6 on Friday.  The last 3 weeks have kinda flown by and I'm hoping the next 3 will fly too. I also work in the education field, but on the transportation side.  Running buses up and down the road every day is stressful too so I can relate to those who are teachers out there going through this stuff.  I agree with Anafoefana in that this part is not so bad after surgery and chemo.  I think chemo has been by far the worse for me so far.  It just seemed like the more treatments I had the SE's got worse.  So far the only bad thing about rads for me is the drive up there and back EVERY day.  It gets on my nerves to have to fight the traffic every day.  But this, too, shall pass.  And pretty soon it will all be over for us and we can find our new normal. Hope you all have a wonderful rest of the weekend.   Wishing everyone well next week as we begin the rads all over again. HUGS to each and everyone of you.  You all make going through this so much easier!  So glad to have the support here that we have.
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2012 10:09PM rjbaby69 wrote: Hello ladies.  Hope everyone is doing well tonight. Lifechanging2011:  I was also diagnosed with high blood pressure.  I'm pretty sure my cancer did not cause mine.  When I went in to see my PCP about some anxiety meds, he put me on blood pressure meds too.  He told me that the last three or four times that I had been in (and there was lots of time in between visits) that my blood pressure was up and that we were going to have to do something about it before I started my journey down Breast Cancer Avenue.  He did and I can tell you I felt so much better after he did that.  I have not had a "tension" headache (which I got often) since he put me on the meds back in July.  My blood pressure is now normal and I am thankful that he did what he did.  But I don't know if the cancer itself can cause high blood pressure but I suspect the anxiety from the diagnosis certainly could!  And do pamper yourself this weekend. Just finished week #4!  Yippee!  Only 2 and 1/2 to go!  I have 13 treatments left and I just can't wait to be done already!  My breast is sore, red and swollen.  Not too bad, but bad enough that I am now noticing some pain.  I try to go braless around the house as much as possible but sometimes that even hurts!  (I'm a 38DD)  I'm still mulling over the idea of bringing out my sports bras.  I think they may be more comfortable.  I hope each and everyone has a wonderful weekend with very few SE's.  Talk to you soon. HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2012 09:40PM rjbaby69 wrote: Congratulations to everyone that's on the DONE side!  I am so happy for ya'll.  I've been done since February 23 and I have to say I'm healing quite nicely.  No more peeling skin just new pink skin where the burns were.  I am still a little sore especially in and around the scar and under my arm.  My RO was right when he told me in about 10 days most of my breast would return to normal.  I'm still wearing my sports bras because my underarm and scar area hurts but I hope to be back in my regular bras soon.  Not rushing things at this point.  I am looking forward to spring break next week.  It will be so nice to lay around, mow the yard, plant some flowers, play with the grandkids and just do exactly what I want to do for 1 week!  Can't wait! Hope you all have a wonderful rest of the week! HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2012 06:55PM rjbaby69 wrote: Kayce234:  Been on tamoxifen since 3-5 and so far, very little SE's.  Had a few headaches and achy body but all in all, very tolerable at this point. Wishing everyone well! HUGS!
Posts.Title: January 2012 rads Kate60 edoyrest
